text:
The purchased section will only show purchased templates on the new system.  HubSpot isn’t responsible for updated templates, I would recommend reaching out the provider (Neambo) and asking if they are willing to give them the new files.
However, the templates will come over as new files, not updated files, which will mean that any pages using the templates will have to be replaced with new templates.  This could become ‘tricky’ if there have been any major edits to either the existing templates, or the updated templates.

Thanks <@U22PWJ41G> 
Thats kind of ridiculous that the client has to go through that since they bought the templates a month before the marketplace got updated. I'll reach out to Neambo. Thanks again!

Is there a resource that explain what fields/variables get passed via the hs-rss-module? Can we access this/alter it with a custom field or something? We are trying to access the feature image alt text in HubL and it is not working as the title of a blog post is getting placed in the alt text for thumbnail image and not the alt text of the actual image - why?
are you looking for the rss_listing hubl tag that’s documented here? <http://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-modules>
Why would this not be passed via the rss module? {{ content.featured_image_alt_text }}

<@U22PU4G4A> Me again … regarding AMP. So once the amp tick has been ticked … is there something else needs to be done so google will load the AMP version … or is just a matter of waiting to the site to be reindexed?
Yeah, once you turn AMP on within your Blog template Google will re-index (and likely cache… more on that in a second) your content. At that point it should show up in mobile search.

A note on caching: Google will automatically cache AMP content and select an AMP version (their cached version, or your site) that is fastest. 98% of the time that I’ve seen at least, Google will select their own cached version.

As a result of that, we don’t advise turning AMP on/off because it could lead to a broken AMP page that Google will not (currently) re-direct to the mobile version (due to the way Google has implemented AMP)
thanks
how about AMP for the rest of the website (HubSpot COS) :slightly_smiling_face:
Any idea how long that cached copy is saved? For example, if a blog post was to be updated, is there a danger of conflicting versions between the standard site and AMP?
We’re talking internally about AMP for Website, but AMP for Blog is the priority right now. We’ll definitely let everyone here know if/when we release it for the overall COS.
Not sure how long they keep a cached version <@U26BLKGE4>. Let me see if I can find out.
Thanks <@U22PU4G4A> !

Following-up the caching question… we believe Google utilizes it’s standard crawler to update cached AMP content. So if you have a blog post that was changed, the next time it’s crawled it should be updated within the AMP version. Timing on that is dependent on Google crawling (or if you re-submit to Google). cc: <@U26BLKGE4>
It’s unclear how long they keep AMP cached content for, so we’ll reach out to Google, but our hunch is they keep it indefinitely.
<@U22PU4G4A> any thoughts on why {{ content.featured_image_alt_text }} is not being passed via the rss module for blog entries?
<@U22PU4G4A> Thanks so much!
Hey <@U26CZR9MW>. Sorry, not really familiar with that, and <@U23602KDF> or <@U22PJPGK0> are likely better to answer your question.
<@U26CZR9MW> do you have a template we can look at to see the problem?
<@U22PJPGK0> I sent you a DM - tnx!
